intro: Tetrataenium candicans, commonly known as the showy tetrataenium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
